markdownRemark.html:
Outline

Multipart upload can cut large files into several parts, upload them to the backend respectively, and then assemble and restore them, which can reduce the pressure of uploading large files.

Component usage

Attachment convenient and efficient, after the global configuration is done, the developer can use it directly with simple configuration.

import { Attachment } from 'choerodon-ui/pro';

const App = () => (
  <Attachment
    ...
    bucketName="xxx"
    useChunk // Enable multipart upload
    chunkSize={5 * 1024 * 1024} // Shard size Default value: 5 * 1024 * 1024
    chunkThreads={3} // Number of upload concurrency Default value: 3
  />
);

Global configuration

Hzero-front has built-in configuration (including multipart upload) in v1.10 and above, so you don't need to configure it yourself.

Earlier versions of hzero-front or non-hzero projects need to use the multipart upload function, and they need to configure the global configuration by themselves. The following configurations are mainly extended on the basis of the regular configuration:

  • onBeforeUpload: Add MD5 encoding properties to attachments before uploading;
  • onBeforeUploadChunk: Each part is checked before uploading;
  • action: Configure multipart upload interface calls;
  • onUploadSuccess: After the attachment is uploaded, you need to call the API again to obtain the complete attachment.
import { configure } from 'choerodon-ui';
import SparkMD5 from 'spark-md5';
import axios from 'axios';

// Generates MD5 encoding from the file for final verification of file integrity
const getMD5Promise = (file) => {
  return new Promise((resolve) => {
    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.readAsArrayBuffer(file);
    reader.onload = (e) => {
      if (e.target) {
        const spark = new SparkMD5.ArrayBuffer();
        spark.append(e.target.result);
        const md5 = spark.end();
        resolve(md5);
      }
    };
  });
};

configure({
  attachment: {
    ... // Other configurations
    onBeforeUpload: async (attachment, _attachments, props) => {
      const { useChunk } = props;
      if (useChunk) {
        const { originFileObj } = attachment;
        // Add MD5 encoding properties to attachment objects before uploading
        attachment.md5 = await getMD5Promise(originFileObj);
      }
    },
    onBeforeUploadChunk: (props) => {
      const {
        attachment: { md5 },
        bucketName,
        chunk: { index },
      } = props;
      // Verify multiparts before uploading
      return axios(`${host}/files/slice/check`, {
        method: 'POST',
        params: {
          bucketName,
          chunk: index,
          guid: md5,
        },
      }).catch((err) => {
        throw new Error(`Multipart upload verification failed with error message:${err}`);
      });
    },
    action: props => {
      const { bucketName, bucketDirectory, attachmentUUID, storageCode, attachment, chunk } = props;
      const headers = {
        'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*',
        processData: false, // The data parameter does not serialize the string
        // method: 'POST',
        type: 'FORM',
        responseType: 'text',
        // Other: Add token information
      };
      const data = {
        attachmentUUID,
        bucketName,
        storageCode,
        directory: bucketDirectory,
      };
      // Multipart upload
      if (chunk) {
        // Intercept file fragments
        const { index } = chunk;
        const slice = chunk.file.originFileObj.slice(chunk.start, chunk.end);
        const formData = new FormData();
        formData.append('file', slice);
        return {
          url: '${host}/files/slice/upload', // Multipart upload interface
          params: { // Parameters required by the backend
            bucketName,
            chunk: index,
            fileName: chunk.file.name,
            guid: attachment.md5,
          },
          headers,
          data: formData,
      };
      }
      // Normal upload
      return {
        url: '${host}/file/upload', // Normal upload interface
        headers,
        data,
      };
    },
    // Upload successful callback
    onUploadSuccess(resp, attachment, props) {
      const { useChunk, bucketName } = props;
      const { md5, name, size, attachmentUUID } = attachment;
      if (useChunk) { // Multipart upload
        axios(`${host}/files/slice/combine`, { // Get the consolidated files
          params: {
            bucketName,
            fileName: name,
            fileSize: size,
            guid: md5,
            attachmentUUID,
          },
        })
        .then((res) => {
          attachment.load({
            ...attachment,
            url: res,
            creationDate: moment(attachment.creationDate).toDate(),
          });
        })
        .catch((err) => {
          throw new Error(`Shard merge failed with error message:${err}`);
        });
      } else {
        // ... Load normal uploaded attachments
        attachment.load({...resp, ...})
      }
    }
  },
});

Core properties

Attachment.props

  • useChunk - Whether to enable sharding
  • chunkSize - The size of each shard, in unit B
  • chunkThreads - Number of concurrent multipart uploads

configure.attachment.props

  • defaultChunkSize - Default upload part size, unit B
  • defaultChunkThreads - The default number of concurrent uploads
  • action - Upload the axios request configuration or return the hook of the axios request configuration
  • onBeforeUpload - Callbacks before uploading
  • onBeforeUploadChunk - Callbacks before multipart uploads

frequently asked questions

  1. After you enable multipart upload, the attachment list is displayed as multiple multipart files?

Answer: Only multipart upload is enabled, which is not configured correctly, resulting in each part being uploaded and returned as a single file, forming a list of multiple parts.

  1. The multipart upload interface is called normally, but the upload cannot be successfully reported for a long time, resulting in an error?

Answer: If the total upload volume is too large, resulting in timeout disconnection, you need to reasonably set the shard size and concurrency number according to the current network environment.

  1. If the project already has a built-in global configuration, where can you modify the information of the uploaded file, such as renaming?

Answer: You can modify the fileName property of the File object in the component beforeUpload callback.

<Attachment
  bucketName='temp'
  beforeUpload={(attachment, attachmentList) => {
  console.log('attachment:', attachment);
  console.log('attachmentList:', attachmentList);
  if (attachment.originFileObj) {
    const file = new File([attachment.originFileObj], 'newName.zip', { type: attachment.originFileObj.type });
    attachment.originFileObj = file;
  }
    return true;
  }}
/>

Notes

  1. The shard size cannot be set less than the minimum limit of the server, otherwise an error will be reported;
  2. The configuration code example is for reference only, please use the correct interface address and pass in the complete necessary parameters in actual use.
